ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] As the Everquest Turns
ygData.msgSnippet: Maybe. Some people are just too dense to listen to anyone. I had some people who were ninja-looters in my group. One guy in particular. He kept looting while
ygData.messageBody:
Maybe. Some people are just too dense to listen to anyone. I had some people
who were ninja-looters in my group. One guy in particular. He kept looting
while we were still fighting. I told him to stop it. (with my female alt).
He tried to claim he had only looted once corpse but I watched him loot 3 in
a row. I told him to stop looting and let others have a chance. Still he
kept hogging loot. We killed a Lego. He sat back and didn't do much while we
killed it but he ran up and looted. He looted a bronze weapon. I said I
wanted to roll for it. Everyone rolled, I got the highest roll. Not only did
he not roll, but he refused to give the brozne weapon up. So he got df
shoulderpads AND the bronze weapon. Finally, we killed the orc weaponsmith.
I said his name and "Do NOT loot the weaponsmith". He looted it. I
immediately disbanded him. He stood around for awhile and didn't seem to
realize he wasn't in group until he tried to loot something. Then he asked
to be allowed back into group. I said "no". I think he was shocked that a
female character was so "harsh". I only wish I had disbanded him before he
could loot the Lego.
luv,
-Su

> I don't have any male characters. I don't know why exactly. I have
noticed
> that my wood elf rogue has been given ALOT of stuff. I don't ask, these
> people just come up and give it to me. The other day my rogue was the
group
> leader at Orc 1 in EC. Maybe I should have used a male character because
I
> can't tell you how many times I said please move back, the whole camp will
> aggro on us when they spawn if we are too close, please move back, add,
add,
> add, ok let's move back, we're pulling the whole camp, hey move back,
please
> move back. Over and over and over. They never did listen. There was 2
who
> were especially bad about it. After my guildmate had dinged, I left the
> camp. I was just tired of trying to explain that the closer we stood,
that
> every spawn would aggro on us no matter if we were ready for them or not.
> And the 2 just didn't seem to have that figured out. I wonder if they
would
> have listened to me if I was something other than a cute female wood elf.
LOL
>
> Lena
>
>
> > I have one male character. I don't know many rl girls who play males.
> > Although I find that while people tend to give more stuff to females,
people
> > listen better to males. ie. as group leader with my female alt I set
loot
> > order and organize strategy. People tend not to obey loot order nor to
they
> > listen to strategy. But even when not as group leader playing a male,
people
> > will listen to my suggestion of loot order as well as strategy. Odd
isn't
> > it?
> > luv,
> > -Su
> >
>
>
>
>
>
>
